_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Bearkat Processing Plant ("Facility") utilizes more than the threshold quantity of a "regulated flammable substance (10,000 pounds)" in the processing of natural gas liquids (NGL), where NGLs are extracted from the inlet gas using a cryogenic process and treated by a glycol dehydration unit prior to being delivered to the pipeline for further market distribution.  The Bearkat Processing Plant also includes an amine treatment system.  This Facility is subject to the Risk Management Plan (RMP) requirements codified in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Part 68 (40 CFR 68) administered by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). 



The Bearkat Processing Plant is a new facility and has not had an accidental release of a regulated substance where exposure to the substance, its reaction products, overpressure generated by an explosion involving the substance, or radiant heat generated by a fire involving the substance led to any off-site death, injury, or response or restoration activities for an exposure of an environmental receptor.  The Bearkat Processing Plant is also subject to Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA's) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and public receptors are located within the worst-case release scenario for the plant.  Therefore, the Bearkat Processing Plant is subject to Preventative Program 3 requirements as stated in 40 CFR 68.10.  OSHA's PSM standard closely parallels requirements outlined in USEPA's RMP Rule.  All elements required by USEPA's 40 CFR 68 - Program 3 Prevention Program are also required by OSHA's PSM. 



The Bearkat Processing Plant employs seven (7) full-time employees on-site who ensure the proper operation and maintenance of the Facility.  



This Facility is anticipated to start operating in September 2014.  This submittal represents the initial RMP submitted by EnLink for the Facility. 



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



The Bea

rkat Processing Plant maintains a policy of safe NGL processing operations, reducing to the greatest extent possible hazards associated with the NGL processing operations, and reducing subsequent risk to the surrounding community, employees, and the environment.    



The Bearkat Processing Plant has procedures in place, including both on-site activities and coordination with off-site responders that are to be followed in the event of an NGL, propane, butane, or natural gas condensate release.



DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Facility stores and processes the following RMP-regulated substances: NGL, propane, butane, and natural gas condensate.  NGL is a flammable mixture that contains n-butane, isobutane, isopentane, and n-pentane; propane is a flammable mixture that contains propane, n-butane, ethane, and propylene; butane is a flammable mixture that contains n-butane and isobutane; and natural gas condensate is a flammable mixture that contains ethane, propane, n-butane, and n-pentane.  



The following provides the maximum storage capacity and largest vessel capacity for all of the RMP-regulated flammables stored at the Bearkat Processing Plant.



RMP STORAGE INVENTORY



Substance            

Propane: Maximum Inventory 3,068 gallons/14,082 pounds; Largest vessel 1,503 gallons/6,899 pounds

Butane: Maximum Inventory 2,977 gallons/14,906 pounds; Largest vessel 2,977 gallons/14,906 pounds

Natural Gas Liquids: Maximum Inventory 94,138 gallons/510,648 pounds; Largest vessel 32,190 gallons/174,613 pounds

Natural Gas Condensate: Maximum Inventory 327,024 gallons/1,773,925 pounds; Largest vessel 42,869 gallons/232,541 pounds



The Bearkat Processing Plant stores natural gas condensate, which under certain circumstances is not classified as a regulated flammable mixture.
